title: How to Make a Littlest Pet Shop Spa

steps.headline: Find a small bowl.
steps.description: Fill with warm water. This serves as the hot tub for the pets to enjoy. Add a towel, a bath brush and some soap.

steps.headline: Use a small bathtub from another play set.
steps.description: This can be the relaxation bath. Add water to it and some bubble bath to make bubbles. Always use cold or lukewarm water; do not use hot water. If you don't want to use real water, don't. Use cotton balls to represent bubbles instead.

steps.headline: Add a sauna.
steps.description: Choose a lukewarm area for this and add towels to make it more reminiscent of a real sauna. Also put cardboard around it to do this.

steps.headline: Find a mini nail set.
steps.description: These can be purchased from beauty sections at many stores.

steps.headline: Use a small box or a doll table.
steps.description: Arrange the nail set on the table.

steps.headline: Place a chair in front and one behind.
steps.description: One pet can be the manicurist, while the other pet receiving nice new nails.

steps.headline: Find suitable makeup.
steps.description: Borrow some makeup from Barbie or My Little Pony if you can't get hold of LPS makeup sets.

steps.headline: Arrange as for the Nail Salon.
Remove the makeup when finished.
steps.description: That way, it won't smudge onto carpet or transfer onto your other toys in storage.

steps.headline: Make a massage table from a small box.
steps.description: A long, slim box is ideal, such as the lid of an iPhone box or similar. Drape with mini blankets or your own homemade mattress to make it nice and soft for the pets.

steps.headline: Make a yoga area.
steps.description: Put mats down on the floor and play some soothing yoga-style music. Hold a special yoga class for the pets. Let them just relax.

steps.headline: Make a reception area.
steps.description: Use a doll desk or a box for the front reception area. Place some flowers on the desk, a bowl of mints and a computer or smart phone for taking appointments. Make a small appointments book for putting in regular visitors' appointment times.

steps.headline: Arrange chairs in the waiting zone.
steps.description: For chairs, bottle caps work well.

steps.headline: Hire workers.
steps.description: Some of the pets can be workers. Place them at their relevant stations, ready for work. It's a good idea to have one per station.

steps.headline: Make mini magazines for your Littlest Pets to read while they wait for their appointment, if desired.
steps.description: Make a lot so other LPS don't feel left out. Have the magazine brands be puns on real brands.
